item.title: Apache REEF
item.dc:creator: viva
item.content:encoded:
What is Apache REEF?

Well, Apache REEF, short for “Retainable Evaluator Execution Framework” offers us a control plane to schedule and coordinate work on the task level on cluster resources that we get from a Resource Manager. REEF gives us the means to help us to develop elastic data processing workflows on cloud platforms that can work with a Resource Manager service. To put it in other words Apache REEF makes the development of Big Data applications on Apache YARN much easier. It is basically a library to help us easily create applications on YARN or Apache Mesos, which are cluster resource managers. Later on we will describe how REEF exactly does this. In essence it simplifies and unifies the lower layers of Big Data systems on modern resource managers.

The origin and aims of Apache REEF

REEF was meant to develop into a Big Data Application Server. During its conceptualisation there was a deep focus on graph computation and machine learning applications. This requires data retention on allocated resources so that multiple passes over the data becomes possible. When the YARN resource management software became decoupled from the limited MapReduce paradigm and acquired more programming framework capabilities, REEF became into being.  Even though MapReduce is fault tolerant, it is not very suitable for a lot of applications. Especially the ones that need main memory computation instead of disk based computations. This MapReduce issue led to the origin of various Big Data systems such as Apache Spark, Google´s Pregel or UCI´s AsterixDB and many more. All of these systems give us new and unique capabilities but remain separated focusing on their respective key functionalities. This makes it difficult for us to share data or compute resources between them. That is why we have YARN, and similar resource managers to bring us in the direction of a unified Big Data collection. The aim of REEF is to deepen this unification even more. It was developed by Microsoft but was open sourced in 2013. REEF is still widely used by Microsoft, namely as the foundation of services such as Azure Stream Analytics. REEF also functions as an essential element for research at well established universities. It continues to have many contributors and is considered as a top level Apache project.

How does Apache REEF work?

Apache REEF is programmed in Java, C# and C++. As mentioned before YARN and Mesos constitute an essential layer in the cloud computing collection, unfortunately their capacity of leasing cluster resources and setting up logic for application is not that high level. This leads to various issues, such as dealing with fault tolerance, task scheduling and coordination or the continuous reimplementation of caching, bulk data transfers and other.  Apache REEF offers us a control plane to address these issues. REEF sets mechanisms in place that help to ease resource reuse for data caching. It offers runtime management help for computational task monitoring and restart, data movement and communications and distributed state management. Apache REEF brings us an application framework on which new analytic toolkits can be easily developed and executed in a resource-managed cluster. It makes the obtaining of resources in the form of Evaluator runtimes easier, it also facilitates the execution of Task instances on Evaluators and eases the communication between the Driver and its Tasks.  Furthermore, Apache REEF is also very powerful at its ability to facilitate the development of reusable data management services. This substantially lessens the strain of authoring the Driver and Task components in a large-scale data processing application. Apache REEF can be considered as a structure that offers us a reusable control plane that makes it possible to systematically reuse resources and retain state across tasks. It fills the gap between Resource Managers and applications. All of this brings us very valuable performance improvements and clears the way for resource and state sharing across different frameworks or computation stages.  To make it more concrete, Apache REEF allows us to easily pipeline data between different operators in a relational data flow and retain state across iterations in iterative or recursive distributed programs.

What are some of Apache REEF´s Features?

It brings us a centralized control flow Apache REEF transforms the chaos of a distributed application into events in a single machine, the Job Driver. These events are container allocation, Task launch, completion and failure. In the case of failures, Apache REEF makes available to the Driver every attempt of making the actual Exception thrown by the Task. REEF offers us Task runtime This is called Evaluator. These evaluators are instantiated in every container of a REEF application. They are able to store data in memory in between Tasks, thereby creating efficient pipelines on REEF. REEF gives support to multiple resource managers Apache REEF has applications that are easily portable to any supported resource manager. And beyond this all new resource managers are easy to sustain in REEF. REEF works with NET and Java API Apache REEF is known to be the only API to write YARN or Mesos applications in .NET. It gets even better, a single REEF application is able to mix and match Tasks written for .NET or Java. REEF supports various Plugins Apache REEF is able to use various plugins, known as Services, to enhance its features and it does this without adding bloat to the core. REEF comes with many Services, such as name-based communications between Tasks, MPI-inspired group communications (Broadcast, Reduce, Gather, …) and data ingress. Remember that YARN makes it possible to run and manage multiple types of jobs atop the same cluster of physical machines. This allows us to not only consolidate the number of systems that an organization has to manage, but it also enables us to run different types of analysis on top of the same data from the same place. But also remember that some types of jobs, such as machine learning, don't work quite well with YARN due to specific requirements around data movement, task monitoring, and the necessity of  iterating on a previous set of results instead of having to start anew every time. That is why we have REEF, this set of libraries that run on top of YARN and solves most of the aforementioned issues.  Apache REEF consists of two main parts: Evaluators, these are YARN containers containing REEF services, and Activities. Activities are the user code that runs inside the Evaluator. In a sample workflow YARN spins up an Evaluator, the Activity code runs inside it and completes, but then the same evaluator can be spun up again and maintain its original state so other Activities could run against its data. This could be anything from a SQL query to another machine learning algorithm.

Conclusion

Apache REEF makes the development of Big Data applications on Apache YARN much easier. It is a step closer to the total unification of Big Data systems. Initially developed by Microsoft, Apache REEF has become a top level open source project that is continuously being developed and further improved. It is a development framework that provides a control-plane for scheduling and coordinating task-level (data-plane) work on cluster resources obtained from a Resource Manager such as YARN. REEF helps us to easily develop elastic data processing workflows on cloud platforms that support a Resource Manager service. With Apache REEF we can build jobs that utilize data from where it's needed and also maintain state after jobs are done. It is perfect for building machine learning jobs. It is used all over and is considered as an essential step towards unification, more ease, efficacy and better control when working with Big Data.

Apache REEF has applications that are easily portable to any supported resource manager. And beyond this all new resource managers are easy to sustain in REEF.<\/span><\/p>"},{"_id":"e141464","tab_title":"REEF works with NET and Java API","tab_content":"

Apache REEF is known to be the only API to write YARN or Mesos applications in .NET. It gets even better, a single REEF application is able to mix and match Tasks written for .NET or Java.<\/span><\/p>"},{"_id":"898850b","tab_title":"REEF supports various Plugins","tab_content":"

Apache REEF is able to use various plugins, known as Services, to enhance its features and it does this without adding bloat to the core. REEF comes with many Services, such as name-based communications between Tasks, MPI-inspired group communications (Broadcast, Reduce, Gather, \u2026) and data ingress.<\/span><\/p>"}]},"elements":[],"widgetType":"toggle"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false},{"id":"f0fb164","elType":"section","settings":[],"elements":[{"id":"d301fd6","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"_inline_size":null},"elements":[{"id":"300852f","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"

Remember that YARN makes it possible to run and manage multiple types of jobs atop the same cluster of physical machines. This allows us to not only consolidate the number of systems that an organization has to manage, but it also enables us to run different types of analysis on top of the same data from the same place. But also remember that some types of jobs, such as machine learning, don't work quite well with YARN due to specific requirements around data movement, task monitoring, and the necessity of\u00a0 iterating on a previous set of results instead of having to start anew every time. That is why we have REEF, this set of libraries that run on top of YARN and solves most of the aforementioned issues.\u00a0<\/span><\/p>

Apache\u00a0<\/span>REEF consists of two main parts: Evaluators, these are YARN containers containing REEF services, and Activities. Activities are the user code that runs inside the Evaluator. In a sample workflow YARN spins up an Evaluator, the Activity code runs inside it and completes, but then the same evaluator can be spun up again and maintain its original state so other Activities could run against its data. This could be anything from a SQL query to another machine learning algorithm.<\/p>"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false},{"id":"3f8eb818","elType":"section","settings":[],"elements":[{"id":"18a882c8","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"_inline_size":null},"elements":[{"id":"6f6817ac","elType":"widget","settings":{"title":"Conclusion"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false},{"id":"750d4fc7","elType":"section","settings":[],"elements":[{"id":"7fde37fb","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"_inline_size":null},"elements":[{"id":"5ac16260","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"

Apache REEF makes the development of Big Data applications on Apache YARN much easier. It is a step closer to the total unification of Big Data systems. Initially developed by Microsoft, Apache REEF has become a top level open source project that is continuously being developed and further improved.<\/span><\/p>

It is a development framework that provides a control-plane for scheduling and coordinating task-level (data-plane) work on cluster resources obtained from a Resource Manager such as YARN. REEF helps us to easily develop elastic data processing workflows on cloud platforms that support a Resource Manager service.<\/p>\n

<\/p>\n

With Apache REEF we can build jobs that utilize data from where it's needed and also maintain state after jobs are done. It is perfect for building machine learning jobs. It is used all over and is considered as an essential step towards unification, more ease, efficacy and better control when working with Big Data. <\/span><\/p>"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

item.title: Apache Storm
item.dc:creator: viva
item.content:encoded:
What is Apache Storm?

It's time to discover what Apache Storm is all about. How did it start, why should you use it, who is using it and how does it work? Apache Storm is, as you guessed, an open source Big Data processing engine. More specifically, it is an advanced Big Data processing engine that can process real-time streaming data at a speed as fast as lightning! Which is way faster than Apache Hadoop. :) Apache Storm can process more than a million jobs in milliseconds. It is not difficult to implement and it works smoothly with any programming language, dastabase or other tool. Furthermore, Apache Storm can be used with Hadoop to offer higher flow rates.

The origin of Apache Storm

Nathan Marz developed Storm at BackType, a marketing intelligence company bought by Twitter in 2011. In 2013 Twitter decided to give Storm to the public, through GitHub. That same year the Apache Software Foundation brought Storm in as an incubator project. Some high class applications were added and ever since Apache Storm is one of the top players in Big Data Analytics. Offering many valuable applications alone or in conjunction with other tools. To be more exact, Storm became an Apache Top-Level Project in September 2014.

How does Apache Storm work?

Apache Storm is a distributed stream processing computation framework. It is for the most part written  in the Clojure programming language. Any application in Storm is created as a topology that takes the shape of a DAG or directed acyclic graph. The graph vertices are made out of spouts and bolts. Streams are the edges on the graph, they take care of guiding data from on node to another. The whole functions as a data transformation pipeline. It looks pretty similar to a MapReduce job, but the big advantage with Storm is that data is processed in real time and not in individual batches. These custom created spouts and bolts create information sources and transactions to make batch distributed processing of streaming data possible.

What is the architecture of Apache Storm?

The Apache Storm cluster consists of the following valuable parts: On one side we have the Nodes. We can distinguish two types of nodes. There are Master Nodes and Worker Nodes. A Master Node performs a daemon Nimbus, this basically gives tasks to machines and controls how they are executing it. Next to the Master Nodes we have Worker Nodes. A Worker node executes a daemon called Supervisor. This Supervisor designates these tasks to other worker nodes and when needed works on them.  To help Storm with the inspection of the clusters there is a thing called the ZooKeeper. This ZooKeeper  does the evaluation of clusters and joins the Nimbus with the Supervisors. It greatly enhances communication between Nimbus and Supervisors, such as the acknowledgments of messages or their processing status and much more. As mentioned earlier Storm functions with three elements, these are Topology, Stream and Spout. Where topology is a network consisting of Stream and Spout. Stream is an unrestricted pipeline of tuples and Spout transforms the data into the tuple of streams and forwards it to the bolts so that it can be processed. 

What is Apache Storm used for?

Well, what is Apache Storm actually used for, you wonder? In essence Apache Storm is considered as the Hadoop of real-time processing. With Storm it becomes easy to reliably handle unbounded datastreams. Exactly the same as Hadoop does for batch processing but then for real time processing. That is exactly why they built Storm for massive expandability, for Storm to deal with fault tolerance and execute thorough processing of all tuples. The topology Storm creates is similar to MapReduce in Hadoop but, as said earlier, Storm works with real time processing of an unrestricted pipeline of tuples. When we start a topology is started the spouts are there to put the data in the system and give it to the bolts. This is where the main data processing work takes place. During processing the bolts can write data onto a database, contact another external system or just provide the user with the results. Storm has many valuable spouts in its arsenal that are able to receive data from an enormous variety of sources. This is one of the many valuable assets Apache Storm offers. The spouts can receive data from the Twitter streaming API, Apache Kafka, JMS brokers and many many more! If you want you could effortlessly use Apache Storm together with Hadoop, there are adapters that can perfectly integrate with HDFS file systems. It gets even better! Even though Apache Storm is founded on Clojure and works with JVM, we can write the spouts and bolts in practically any language we desire. By now you can clearly see that Apache Storm totally excels at event stream processing! It is an extremely scalable, ultra fast and fault tolerant open source system that is skilled at event processing, incremental processing and computing rolling metrics live over various streams of data. We would now like to explicitly go over Apache Storm´s valuable one of a kind features!

Why use Apache Storm or 8 of Storm´s worthwile features

Apache Storm offers a wide array of use cases: real time analytics, online machine learning, continuous computation, distributed RPC, ETL, and so much more. Below we go over some priceless features! Total boundless Integration Apache Storm can work with any queueing or database system. Comes with an easy API Apache Storm has an unsophisticated and user friendly API. When we use Apache Storm we work with streams of tuples or named lists of values. It doesn’t matter what object you need to work with and if it’s not available it is pretty straightforward to establish one. Made to offer maximum Scalability The topologies are by nature parallel and they run across a cluster of machines. We can scale parts of the topology each individually by altering their parallelism. Because of this parallelism Apache Storm can go through a massive amount of data at ultra fast speed. Made to be highly Fault tolerant When workers stop functioning they get automatically restarted, if it is a lost case this worker will be restarted on another node. If Apache Storm Daemons get destroyed the overall state of the cluster of topologies will not be harmed. No fail total data processing With Apache Storm every tuple will be totally processed.  Apache Storm’s default setting does an at-least-once processing guarantee. Implying that messages are only replayed in case of failures. Speaks any language The creators really sought Apache Storm to be usable with any programming language. There is a Thrift definition at the centre of Apache Storm that defines and submits topologies. Given that Thrift works in any language therefore topologies can too. Even more, spouts and bolts can be defined in any language. There are adaptors to allow you to do this in Ruby, Python, java script and Perl. Oh so easy to implement and work with. The clusters are just too easy to implement with a very minimal installation and configuration. It is also very robust, the cluster is, once activated, able to process time after time. Apache or free and open source This means it has a vast and continuously developing ecosystem of libraries and tools to use. Such as an easy integration with JMS; Kafka, Redis,.. It is also not difficult to take care of massive amounts of in- memory state in your calculations. This is done reliably through a distributed file system. Furthermore there is the possibility of integration with various databases and there are many other truly valuable options of using open source and free software! Total and impeccable Reliability Apache Storm makes sure that each incoming message is always totally processed, even in cases when the data is distributed over hundreds of nodes.

Which companies use Apache Storm?

What are some of the companies that use Apache Storm? Well, one of them is the Weather Channel, they use Storm topologies to process weather data, to collect or save data and the high fault tolerance is particularly useful to them. Another company that uses Apache Storm is Twitter. Twitter uses it for discovery, real time analytics, search, .. and much more, It can integrate perfectly with Twitter´s infrastructure such as the used database systems, the way the messaging is set up and systems in place for monitoring or alerting. Lastly, we would like to mention Spotify which uses Apache Storm for their real time features. Spotify uses Apache Storm in conjunction with Kafka, memcached and Cassandra enabling Spotify to easily build low latency fault tolerant distributed systems.

Conclusion

Apache Storm a.k.a the Hadoop for real-time processing has the capabilities needed by companies working with massive amounts of data. Real-time processing is something everyone needs these days! Furthermore, Apache Storm truly embodies reliability and automatic recovery without ever hurting the whole operation, everything will be processed at least once even in the face of failure. It is totally user friendly, open source, free and easy to set up and implement. In combination with other stellar technologies such as Trident, Apache Whirr and Kafka .. this solid and real processing engine will continue to be popular and widely used! Its use cases are virtually endless, such as real time analytics, online machine learning, ETL,.. it is ultra fast, totally reliable, massively scalable, fault tolerant  and user friendly! Making Apache Storm a magical and totally efficient tool!

item.title: This CA Root certificate is not trusted
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
"To enable trus, install this certificate in the Trusted Root Certification Authorities store."
If you ever get this error and can't install the certificate, then add the site you are currently accessing to the trusted sites. You will be able to install the certificate

item.title: What is a compute cycle at Mosso?
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
I recently opened an account in Mosso (www.mosso.com, part ofwww. rackspace.com) to host my sites.  Indeed it is more expensive than other options.  I pay $100 a month, and in similar services I could get something similar for $10 a month. (Similar services at least offer roughly same amount of space, unlimited sites, many GB of bandwidth) So why I am paying 10x more.  Well, for starters I am in the process of creating an app that I hope/dream will grow and I need the stability, scalability and performance of Mosso.  That is one reason, the other is that they offer a customer service like I haven't seen anywhere else.  Email, knowledge base, forum you can get anywhere.  But with Mosso I have a problem, I log in, click on live help and in snap I have someone helping me.  Maybe not worth the full 10x difference, however it definitively pays.   They offer more services that no one else does, like billing your customers, and best of all you get 50 GB space (which is a lot for asp net sites) and 500GB of transfer.  Quite a bit and enough for what I need now. And you pay more for what you need. Of course you always look for a catch, and in this case I thought it is the compute cycle.  They offer 10,000 compute cycles. Of course I have no idea of what that is, and was afraid of ending up paying a lot more for them.  So here is what they say a compute cycle is. Compute cycle: Compute cycles measure how much processing time your applications require on the Cloud Sites. Using 10,000 compute cycles in a month is roughly equivalent to running a server with a 2.8 GHz modern processor for the same period of time. You can read it here http://help.mosso.com/article.php?id=268 And then, how much is that?  They also have an estimate. Mosso says the following:
  • about 2.1 million page views using a database-driven content management system
  • about 11 million page views of mosso.com
  • about 25 million requests for a static 15KB image
    • http://help.mosso.com/article.php?id=269 Well, hope that helps

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Compute cycles in Mosso, what do they mean?
compute cycles, mosso, rackspace, web hosting

item.title: Best way to create a VPN - Use Hamachi
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
I was this close to paying Amnet (one of Costa Rica's useless ISP) for a public IP to be able to use my nice server which is set up (or in the process of) with a lot of tools that I use for my next enterprise, setting up my own company. We already achieved our first little baby steps milestone. Will it be custom dev? SEO? marketing? a tool? a product? a service? I will tell soon :)
Well, let's go back to the story, I had to have access from anywhere to my files while I am developing (and also my Music - 70 GB don't fit in an iphone).
So, what is the solution? Use Hamachi. Hamachi is a vpn emulator that's free for non commercial use and as little as $4 for commercial use.
Hamachi VPN Evolved LogMeIn Hamachi: Instant, Zero Configuration VPN
Try it, it works wonderfully. I am listening to my itunes library from across town and logged into my Microsoft Windows 2008 server via terminal server. Find Hamachi here https://secure.logmein.com/products/hamachi/vpn.asp

item.title: Google Analytics tip: Don't count yourself in your traffic, create a filter
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
One common mistake a lot of people do is they count themselves as traffic to their own site. Don't! You may visit your own site hundreds of times a week (in an addicted scenario), but remove yourself by creating a filter in Google Analytics as you want real data and you are moving the average by quite a bit. Create a filter in google analytics by following this instructions: http://www.google.com/support/analytics/bin/answer.py?answer=55496
To find out your ip go to http://www.whatismyip.com/

item.title: Maximum number connections exceeded Windows Server Terminal Server
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
Does it happen to you that annoying message were you can't connect again to a server you were connected to in the first place.
Why is Windows so stubborn as not to recognize that you are the person logged in the session that just disconnected and want to reconnect via terminal server.
Try this, it works like a charm mstsc /v:<server> /admin
It works the same in Windows Server 2003 and 2008

item.title: Money advice during tough times taken from Money Central
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Today I've been working on multiple things, most of them computer related.  So, at some point I needed to read about something else.  I clicked onone of the Windows Live Messenger today window's article and got sucked up into reading plenty of money related articles for times like these.  Very interesting, and a lot of them apply extremely well.  In summary this is what I extracted from them: - Pay yourself first (also a good advice from Rich Dad, Poor Dad from Robert T. Kiyosaki) - Pay your necessities first.  Start with rent, food, gas and others.  Prioritize your bills.   - Use cash as much as possible.  I am one that had a race with the credit card because I loved earning points and then spending those.  That is a stupid move, don't let the BAC San Jose trick you into it.  It actually worked for me very well when I had to buy everything for the office, now that it is my money I am going to open a debit card with Banco Nacional and make a better work at living on a predefined budget. - Understand one thing, living on a budget does not mean you have to starve.  It means calculating how much you can really spend and try to live on that.  If you go over it is not a big deal, but organize yourself. - Live within your means.  I know this is a hard one.  Once you get used to something, it is difficult to let go.  I was addicted to Amazon and I can assure you I have bought so many things that I didn't need. - Keeping up with the Joneses.  Why do we always want to have the same or more than other people.  I accept I was a little like that, I loved having more than other people.  In these last couple of years I have been more frugal.  And I have confess that I like it better like this.  Once you learn that not everything is a rat race, you live happier.  It is exactly the same as the phrase eat to live and not live to eat.  Same thing, but just applied to a materialistic lifestyle.   There are many other advices I could give you from what I read today, but why don't you just take a few minutes and read some of these: HugeDebts Paid Off Fast When Paying Off Debt Is A Bad Idea Your Stupidest Money Moves Get Off The Spending Treadmill Living Poor And Loving It 10 Bad Habits That Lead To Debt Disaster

item.title: Unable to create My Site in sharepoint
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
If you can't create your my site in sharepoint and you are the admin, check the self service creation in the central administration
It can save you a lot of time.
You need to enable self service creation. To do so:
-Click Start -> All Programs -> Administrative Tools -> SharePoint Central Administration. -Go to Virtual Server Configuration, click Configure virtual server settings. -Click virtual server to enable on the virtual server page. -Under Automated Web Site Collection Management, click on Configure Self-Service Site Creation. - Then select On in the Enable Self-Service Site Creation section
Also, if you are deploying for the extranet you might consider hosting the sites under port 80 instead of the default 82. Check out this post by Chris Johnson on how to move your sites to port 80. http://blogs.msdn.com/cjohnson/archive/2006/09/15/754902.aspx. One note on this steps, please remember to browse to the newly create site for the my site host and click on "set as my site host". And don't forget to apply theme and master page.
If you are having trouble accessing your sites from the outside, also check the My Site trusted locations and finally don't forget about the alternate access mappings.
Well... so many things required to set up my sites to work properly in SharePoint 2007....

item.title: Unable to connect to SharePoint using SharePoint designer
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: If you can't connect to your SharePoint server using SharePoint designer, one of the possibilities of what happened is that you have a remove tag added after after the add ScriptResource.axd. To solve try this: - Use fiddler2 to determine issue. Download it from here www.fiddler2.com - Check the error messages - If you see access denied (http response code 401) to /_vti_bin/usergroup.asmx then it might be that you added AJAX support and the entries are in incorrect order in the web config Description of the problem <remove verb="*" path="*.asmx" /> is inserted automatically after <add verb="GET,HEAD" path="ScriptResource.axd" <add verb="*" path="*.asmx" validate="false" type="System.Web.Script.Services.ScriptHandlerFactory, System.Web.Extensions, Version=3.5.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31BF3856AD364E35"/> This Means the .asmx pages do not work on the sharepoint server after adding the feature. This also prevents you edit the site using sharepoint designer because /_vti_bin/usergroup.asmx will give a 401 access denied error. The issue is here: <remove verb="*" path="*.asmx" /> Simply remove the tag and it will work Check out the resolution here http://features.codeplex.com/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=6623

item.title: Becoming a member of the Costa Rica Indoor Club
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
I grew up as a member in Costa Rica's Indoor Club(www.indoorclub.com). I loved the place, pretty nice and spent countless hours there. I called today to find out how much it costs to become a member. Oh my bloody jesus!
If you want to become a member $4000 for becoming a member and $10000 for the entry fee
If you want to inherit your parents membership $7000 if you they are under 60
I cannot stress how much these people are crazy!!!!!
Again, living in Costa Rica is extremely expensive. From electronics(50% to 60% tax) to cars(59% to 89%), social security(a lot of %) and many other items this country really does not make sense at all....

item.title: High speed internet in costa rica - a monopoly after all...
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: I've been feeling my internet connection kind of shaky lately so I decide to give it a shot and run a bandwidth test. You have no idea how much I hate the idea of doing this, given that I pay around $65 a month for a 2048/768 connection. God! for that much money other countries can get 12 mbps! Well, here is what I am getting... [caption id="attachment_89" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="speedtest in costa rica"][/caption] That means the down speed seems decent. But the up speed!!! It is close to dial up :( You know what the problem is? That even though we have multiple companies providing internet service, it all goes down to the government at the end of the day. My cable company is Amnet, although they depend on Racsa for the service. How can we expect a decent service if internet is a monopoly just like a lot of other services? Come on Costa Rica, grow up!!!! Competition is sane. And ICE, I think it is time you start selling IPhones, and for a decent price! Well, for now let's keep living with this horrible service. I see my country evolving, but not as fast as I would like it to.

item.title: Turubari River - incredible place for an outdoor bbq in Costa Rica
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Have you ever been bored on a weekend with nothing really out of the ordinary to do? You want some out door trip, nothing extreme but - don't want to damage your car - but still you can hear the call of adventure. Well, for those of us lucky enough to live in Costa Rica we have Turubari, the Turrubares river. Pretty much is one of nicest places you can go without investing too much and as easily accessible as it can be. These are some pictures taken on some of the multiple trips we've done Land Rover 88 (my Tonka) coming out of the river [caption id="attachment_105" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Land rover in Turrubari, Costa Rica"][/caption] The so called Sea Rover [caption id="attachment_107" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Sea Rover"][/caption] As I said, easily accessible [caption id="attachment_108" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="turubari, not only for offroading"][/caption] You can also ski on the river, just find yourself a big truck to pull you [caption id="attachment_109" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="skiing in costa rica in turrubares river"][/caption] Jossi in his Chapuliln Colorado [caption id="attachment_110" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="jossi in turubari"][/caption] Also, you can play around and do 8's [caption id="attachment_113" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="who can do an 8 in a land rover"][/caption] The difference between a man and a boy is the size of his toys [caption id="attachment_112" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The difference between a man and a boy is the size of his toys"][/caption]

item.title: Sistema de alertas de uso del BAC San Jose - Robo de tarjeta o ineficiencia en linea?

item.content:encoded: Basicamente hoy me paso lo mismo que me hace dias ha venido pasando. Recibo una alerta del BAC que dice algo como asi Transacciones en su tarjeta Credomatic Credomatic Informa to me Visa Clasico: Estimado Tarjetahabiente, Credomatic Informa hace de su conocimiento que se han superado el número de transacciones diarias establecidas en nuestro sistema de avisos. Fecha Monto Comercio Moneda Estado ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 12/10/09 13:10 8000.00 FLORISTERIA ARCO IRIS Colones Aprobado 12/10/09 19:22 4000.00 ESTACION DE SER.CALLE BLASAN Colones Aprobado 13/10/09 06:12 28700.00 ESTACION DE SERVICIO PACIFIC Colones Aprobado Resulta que la primera vez que recibi una notificacion de este tipico llame en panico pues segun yo me habian robado la tarjeta pues no hice ninguna de esas compras. Pero despues de revisar un rato con servicio al cliente de credomatic me dicen que "no se preocupe, es solo un error del sistema. Le enviamos un correo equivocado. A veces pasa...". Acaso no piensan las implicaciones de un error de este tipo? No es un error simple, estan cometiendo errores con el dinero de personas. BAC San Jose, sean mas serios por favor. Con el dinero no se juega. Ah por cierto, me queje y me dijeron que habian arreglando el problema. Mentira, sigue pasando. Ya van 3 asi que decidi escribir al respecto. Por ahora sigo con este problema, vamos a ver cuando me lo arreglan... [caption id="attachment_119" align="aligncenter" width="838" caption="error del bac san jose"][/caption]

item.title: Skype Review: skype in, skype out, call forwarding
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Skype is a cheap way to talk... is it? Today I was beginning to write a post on one thing that really annoys me from the new business version of skype. As soon as I dial in to a conference call, while I am hearing the "welcome to the microsoft conference calling center...." message I always start dialing the passcode. However, every time I am doing it I get a "Your microphone is too quiet message". I know my microphone is quiet, I am not talking. I am dialing in. Thanks for the info, but can you show a balloon or a different message? The bottom line is when you show the message, you move the dial pad which makes me miss and have to dial in again and talk to myself which makes me feel stupid. [caption id="attachment_131" align="aligncenter" width="884" caption="annoying new skype \"feature\""][/caption] But back to my new thought. Skype is cheap, yes. But today I checked how much money I have spent in the last couple of years and SURPRISE! I've spent $895. Seems pretty steep. However makes me wonder how much it would've costed me if I used traditional methods. I was impressed when I saw $895, but given that a 30 minute call is like $20 through traditional lines calling the US from Costa Rica, I am delighted to pay for Skype. Little by little you see your payments grow to close to 1k! Date Item Amount Status 8-Oct-09 Auto Top Up on low balance $10.00 Delivered 1-Oct-09 Auto Top Up on low balance $10.00 Delivered 27-Sep-09 Unlimited US & Canada 1 month $2.95 Delivered 18-Sep-09 Online number, 12 month subscription $30.00 Delivered 27-Aug-09 Unlimited US & Canada 1 month $2.95 Delivered 12-Aug-09 Auto Top Up on low balance $10.00 Delivered 27-Jul-09 Unlimited US & Canada 1 month $2.95 Delivered 30-Jun-09 Auto Top Up on low balance $10.00 Delivered I have skype in, skype out, voice mail, forwarding and more and I would have to say that it is definitively worth it!

item.title: Sera posible que sean tan descaradas las gasolineras?
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Se los voy a resumir y luego lo leen a detalle si quieren. La cosa es asi: dicen que las gasolineras nos estan estafando de a poquitos y parece que si es cierto. Como nosotros siempre pedimos que le echen X rojos de gas, lo que pasa es que las maquinas dan un menor porcentaje de gasolina, talvez un 90% segun lo que he oido. Si pedis en litros si sale exacto, pues asi es como les hacen las auditorias a las gasolineras. Yo pense que era solo una hablada, pero el nissan de mi mama que se llenaba con 23 mil colones desde vacio, pidio este finde que se lo llenaran con X litros (recordando el numero que siempre dice) y se le lleno con 19 mil. Mi hermano calcula que le esta sacando 50 kilometros mas pidiendolo por litros. Es otra de las formas en la que los ticos se tratan de aprovechar de los demas. Esa mentalidad del tico que tanto odio. Si en la sociedad hubiera menos personas tratando de jugar de "vivazos" y mas gente trabajara duro y cooperaramos los unos con los otros, todos ganariamos. Pero por gente como esta es que seguiremos siendo un paisito tercermundista feliz por que hace buen cafe y tiene mucho turismo (claro, el turismo basicamente esta desequilibrando todo nuestro ecosistema por que la gente solo piensa en cuanto le puede sacer de plata al gringo y no que esta destruyendo para su propio beneficio) Volviendo al tema de la gasolina, QUE DESCARO!!!! Vean el correo que enviaron, el cual no creia hasta que en mi familia y algunos amigos lo comprobaron. "Cuando vamos a cargar gasolina siempre pedimos múltiplos de dinero, según nuestros bolsillos (5000,10000, 20000 etc) o decimos: 'llenelo' pues ahí esta la trampa, cuando el despachador 'programa' colones o solo abre la bomba manda una señal a la computadora central de la gasolinera y esta a su vez le envía a la bomba que despache litros de 900, 850 ó 800 mililitros en vez de 1000 que es un litro, a través de un software especial, así de triste. Lo cual quiere decir que por cada ¢1000 de gasolina en realidad recibes, si bien te va, ¢900. Así que has cuentas cuanto te han robado en el último año si cargas promedio ¢10000 diarios sencillo entre 3,000 y 4,000 colones, esto multiplicado por millones de autos. ¿Como evitarlo? Cuando cargues pide que te carguen múltiplos de 20 litros (20,40,60 etc) no en colones según la capacidad de tu vehiculo, las bombas pueden despachar por litros, ¿donde esta el truco? Muy sencillo. Las cubetas verificadoras son de 20 litros exactos, cuando esto sucede el software recibe alerta que existe una posible revisión oficial y ordena a la bomba mande los 1000 mililitros exactos que contiene un litro." Aca hay una discusion en la cual hablan del tema y alguno de estos maes lo probaron y es cierto http://www.4x4costarica.com/foro/viewtopic.php?f=1&t=3407&start=0

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Sera posible que sean tan descaradas las gasolineras?
Las gasolineras nos estafan lentamente y a poquitos. Pida en litros, no por plata

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Yo había recibido ese correo también pero siempre que lleno el tanque se me olvida pedir litros.
Esta semana hago la prueba de pedir X litros a ver por cuánto me están atornillando usualmente.

Me gustaría decir que suena "increíble", pero tristemente ya ningún tipo de robo en este país me sorprende. Es más, estoy seguro de que si todo el mundo empieza a pedir por litros, alguna otra forma se van a inventar. Ojalá hubiera leído esto ayer. Habría probado hoy que fui a cargar gasolina.
Diay ahi me cuenta como le va. Bateando, su tanque debe de ser de 40 litros
Mae Stephen, esa es la mentalidad del tico. Como vos decis, tristemente algo nuevo van a inventar para aprovecharse de uno.

Lei tu blog y no estoy de acuerdo. No estas dando argumentos validos y ademas decis "se revela una tolerancia en los repostajes de hasta 100ml. por litro", lo cual indica que si se estan robando hasta un 10% pues la "tolerancia" es para el beneficio de la gasolinera, afectando al cliente.
Y la otra es que tampoco sabes de lo que hablas cuando decis "No es cierto, hay muchos surtidore que no permiten programar litros, por lo que hacemos es coger una calculadora y multiplicar los litros pedidos por su precio y programar esa cantidad en euros y otros surtidores permiten programar los litros". Estas mal informado, pues en Costa Rica lo mas comun es indicar la cantidad de dinero y no litros.

item.title: Riteve quiere subir tarifas en Costa Rica - no les da pena?
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Yo no se si soy solo yo, pero no entiendo como puede pasar esto. Voy de nuevo, RTV es un monopolio privado y obligatorio!!!! Eso significa que todos estamos obligados a pagar por un servicio que tiene cierta logica, pero con estas calles el mantenimiento de los carros es carisimo (y los carros ni que hablar, con estos impuestos por traer carros es un milagro que no andamos en caballo todavia) y tras de eso quieren DUPLICAR y un poco mas las tarifas. Veanlo uds mismos: http://www.nacion.com/ln_ee/2009/noviembre/25/pais2172084.html No ven el negocio mas que redondo, uno lleva el carro, un pelado ahi que le pagan por devolver carros se inventa cualquier cosa para que uno tenga que volver a llevar el carro y asi RTV gana DOBLE o TRIPLE!!!! Las historias que he oido son muchas, todas llenas de frustracion (y lo he vivido tambien). A uno lo devuelven por cualquier tontera solo para que tenga que pagar. Mucha gente lleva el carro al dia siguiente, vuelve a pagar y ahi el carro si pasa. Y eso que no le hacen nada al carro. Eso significa que lo devolvieron el dia anterior por algo subjetivo, o solo por que les dio la gana. Por lo tanto yo propongo: - RTV se pueda hacer por multiples talleres -> la competencia siempre es buena - Precio decente - Que cualquier arreglo al carro por los mal estado de las calles se deducible de impuestos o que le bajen los impuestos a los carros. El gobierno quiere que tengamos carros bonitos? Que los haga accesibles para el pueblo!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Completamente de acuerdo.
Los buses de Alajuela no van a RTV (tendra que ver que es del mismo due~o?)

Mae Chiri, no lo puedo creer. Que es ese abuso y chorizo!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Yo lo digo y lo repito, hay que hacer algo en este pais. Pero todos decimos que hay que hacer algo, pero nadie hace....

Toda la razon, ademas de que si uno le da el carro a un mecanico con compas ahi adentro le pasa el carro en el estado que este, a mi me devolvieron el carro en RTV por tres faltas leves y mi mecanico al dia siguiente lo paso sin arreglarle nada, cuando le pregunte que hizo, nada mas me guiño el ojo y me dijo que tenia sus "compas" ahi

Mae Sergio, totalmente de acuerdo. Pero va mas alla de eso, mi papa llevo el carro, se lo devolvieron y mi tata lo llevo al dia siguiente sin hacerle nada y le dijeron "muy bien, arreglo la falta".
Ese es mi punto, hacen y deshacen en RTV lo que les da la gana y uno paga los platos rotos por algun chorizo, quien sabe cuanto pagaron por debajo de la mesa para hacer este contrato. Esto va en contra del sentido comun y de todos los costarricenses.

item.title: Sistemas bancarios del BAC San Jose - Si es asi en otros calculos pues que miedo!
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Hace varios meses descubri un error en el sistema bancario del BAC San Jose. Les mande un correo haciendoles notar el error pero me ignoraron (para variar - de fijo ya me tienen marcado como cliente "dificil"). No voy a extender mucho el cuento, asi que se los voy a describir rapidamente 1. Entren a su pagina del BAC San Jose en www.bac.net 2. Metanse a su consulta de saldos de la tarjeta. Pero no a la de pagar, si no a la de donde salen todas sus compras. Ahi hay un cuadrito para pagar, seleccionen ahi para escribir el monto en dolares. [caption id="attachment_168" align="alignleft" width="741" caption="Seleccionar pagar tarjeta credito"][/caption] Luego escriban el monto de dolares que quieren pagar y le dan click al boton de pagar. A continuacion ven la parte divertida. Se equivocan a la hora de hacer el pago, pues en vez de pagar en dolares toman en cuenta el total como si fueran colones. Es decir, queria pagar 1257 dolares y el banco los toma como si fueran 1257 colones. [caption id="attachment_169" align="aligncenter" width="733" caption="Mal calculo de parte del bac"][/caption] Hay otra forma de pagar bien y es entrar directo a la pagina de pago de tarjeta. Pero ese no es el punto. El punto mio es que que miedo si hacen errores como este, que otros errores de calculos tendran en el sistema? Sera que perdemos plata por errores de este tipo? No quiero ser paranoico, pero cuantos de nosotros calculamos con exactitud lo que gastamos y cerramos cuentas? Cuantos habremos perdido platilla en errores asi? Si le llamo la atencion este error, cuentele a un amigo!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Mae, que interesante observación... aunque...
A mi no me pasa, estoy 100% seguro, yo toda la vida hago los pagos así y siempre me hace el rebajo correcto ... Pero igual me da como miedo :s
Mae, hay dos lugares para pagar la tarjeta. No le de click al de pagar, dele click dentro de donde sale el estado de cuenta o los movimientos. Es ahi donde esta mal
El BAC es una basura. Credomatic es peor.
Estoy totalmente de acuerdo, voy a probar con el HSBC, tuve una buena experiencia en el pasado, vamos a ver como me va esta vez...

item.title: Cuanto ruido en decibeles hace un land rover?
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Dado que me mande a pedir unas varas que me sugirió Rolo para aislar el ruido de mi carro, me decidí a medir el ruido dentro del carro. Esto dado que no puedo ni hablar por telefono con mi esposa mientras manejo y ya me duelen los oidos de empujarme los audifonos hacia adentro para poder apenas oirla. Para tal efecto, compre una aplicacion para el iphone que se encarga de medir el nivel de decibeles en el ambiente. Tuve que pagar $1.99 y pelearme con el hecho que mi iphone no queria sincronizar aplicaciones (lo cual ya se como arreglar - en otro post lo explico). En fin, el app store e itunes a veces no son tan faciles de usar como a uno le gustaria o uno es demasiado chapa! jejeje Por cierto, comprar la aplicación también fue idea de mi hermanito Rolo. Acá esta lo que encontré Cuando uno prende el carro tiene un pequenno brinco que pasa los 100 decibeles, que es el aceleronazo al prenderlo. De ahi en ralenti (idle) se estabiliza en aproximadamente 80 db. En el grafico luego se muestra como acelero un par de veces llegando alrededor de 94db [caption id="attachment_182" align="aligncenter" width="320" caption="medida de db arrancando y acelerando el land rover"][/caption] La siguiente medida la tome acelerando para llegar al porton de oficentro la sabana [caption id="attachment_184" align="aligncenter" width="320" caption="land rover frenado, acelera y sale"][/caption] Y ahora la ultima se ve donde viene el land rover en una recta, compresiono y llega hasta el punto de estar frenado. [caption id="attachment_186" align="aligncenter" width="320" caption="land rover en recta, compresiona hasta frenar"][/caption] Cual es la conclusion? Aproximadamente 80 db en ralenti (idle), de 90 db a 95 db en calle en linea recta (ojo que no en pista) y ya compresionando o muy acelerado llega hasta 105 db. O sea, mi land rover es poco mas que una perforadora pero no tanto como un concierto!!!!!!! Agregado 2010 01 14 Y aca esta la medicion en el carro de mi esposa. Un sedan y tiene como promedio 66 decibeles. Creo que por eso quiero un sedan! Para poder oirme pensar. Queria un Hyundai i10, que estan chivisimas pero no se.... Si quieren saber un poco mas de decibeles leer aca http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decibelio Y para ya los muy tecnicos http://docente.ucol.mx/al058284/decibeles.htm

item.title: Cannot install or transfer apps on Iphone! Application tab greyed out on Itunes!
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: The other day I almost went crazy because I downloaded an application from Itunes Appstore and couldn't transfer my applications to my Iphone 2G (as much as I want to have an Iphone 3G, I will wait until this one dies). After some time of troubleshooting, googling, authorize computer on the itunes, and many other steps, I was able to find out what the problem was. I needed to remove the restrictions on my iphone. To do that go to Settings > General > Restrictions and set them to off. I have no idea why they were set to on, but that did the trick.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Geeeee, Thanks a lot mate, that worked! I gave up on it already as the apple site said that I could only use the apps in the country where I registered my credit card. As I'm travelling around the world, that didn't really make sense to have an iphone then. I'll let you know when I'm around Costa Rica, the beer is on my tab.

Excellent! Glad that it worked! I was also really annoyed by the fact that I couldn't install apps. It's kind of weird that Apple doesn't have a "Your IPhone has restrictions turned on. Please turn off restrictions to be able to install applications" message. They are well known to be user friendly, but I guess we found an exception.
thanks dear it works
My pleasure! Glad I was of assistance!

item.title: Avatar 3D en el IMAX de Avenida Escazu o en VIP Cinepolis Terramall?
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Tengo que aceptarlo, me gusto tanto la pelicula Avatar que la fui a ver dos veces, pero solo lo disfrute una vez. Dejenme explicar la razon.... La primera vez que la vi fui a Terramall VIP a verla, una experiencia increible. La segunda vez la fui a ver al IMAX Nova de Repretel en Avenida Escazu. GRAVE ERROR!!!!!. Tengo que aceptarlo, iba emocionado a ver la pelicula en el IMAX, por que si uds viven en el mismo pais que yo, han oido de toda la publicidad del IMAX: "la pantalla mas grande de este universo!" y otro poco de tonteras pero al fin de cuentas esto es lo que pienso del IMAX: - Es solo un cine con una pantalla un poco mas grande que lo normal - Las filas es algo nunca antes visto. El IMAX se convirtio en el paseito de muchas personas que probablemente si no fuera por eso nunca irian a Escazu (me incluyo, ya que quitaron Sambuka jajajaja) - Como buenos ticos, mientras hacia la fila habia familias tomandose fotos por que estaban en "Avenida Escazu" y querian ensennarle a sus familias donde fueron y lo que vieron (hablo de las tiendas adolfo dominguez, massimo duty, apple y otras que uno tiene que vender el carro para poder comprarse una "mudada". Tambien menciono que como buenos ticos, los veia zampando sanguches, latas y otras cosas en carteras y bolsillos pa meterlos al cine por que las palomitas estan bien caras. - Los asientos son estupi@#$#@$ incomodos, si pague 5 rojos minimo quiero un asientito comodo y que no suene "YYYYY YYYYYYY YYYYYYYYY" cada vez que me muevo - Las filas... de nuevo las filas.... En fin, no se dejen llevar por la publicidad. El imax es solo un cine como cualquier otro, mucho hype, una pantallilla un poco mas grande y ya. Haganse un favor y vayan a Terramall VIP si se quieren chinear. Eso SI vale la pena. Y pa que vean que no miento... de ahi sigue como 100 metros la fila

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Gracias por los comentarios, voy a ir al 3D a ver qué (sólo para decir que conozco y hablar con bases), pero por lo menos ya sé que no es la gran cosota... je je en definitiva creo que pocas cosas por ahora le hagan algo de competencia al VIP de Terramall.

no se exactamente bajo que ezpecificaciones llaman esa pantalla IMAX, pero la que yo tuve la suerte y gusto de ver en Pittsburgh era una pantalla concava, la cual acaparaba los 180 grados de vision que uno tiene. Cuando escuche que en CR se abriria un IMAX me quede un poco extrañado ya que es un chunche muy caro para un mercado tan reducido, claro, cuando me entere como era el IMAX con el que contabamos aca me cayo la pezeta. Xavi, vos que viajas bastante, si tenes el chance de ver alguna film en IMAX de a deveras deberias hacerlo, asi te sacas el mal sabo de boca del IMAX tico

Mae, es que hay dos tipos de imax. Esta el imax domo, que es el que yo crei que tenian. Este es solo una pantalla mas grande de lo normal, nada mas.
Una estafa al final de cuentas. Como lo dije antes, terramal vip es por mucho superior
Mas detalles aca http://entertainment.howstuffworks.com/imax1.htm

Te deseo buena suerte jejejejeje
Talvez sin mucha fila y con un buen lugar algo le haga... nah, la verdad es que Cinepolis todavia esta mejor!
Yo voto por terramall vip jajajajaja A mi me queda mas cerca y los asientos son numerados y cabe un mae el doble de uno en cada asiento.

ok, si, yo me referia a los IMAX domo. Ojala que este cine se ponga las pilas, ya que a uno le sirve por la cercania. Su boleteria tambien deja demasiado que desear, en sus pantallas es dificil entender a que hora esta que pelicula y en que sala, podrian utilizar mejor sus recursos la verdad. y no entiendo cual es el lio que vender ya sea en linea o presencial los ticketes numerados, de esa manera no hay que echarse esas mega-filas, si uno ya tiene el asiento numerado.
en fin, veamos si mejora la cosa
I am actually delighted to read this webpage posts which consists of lots of useful information, thanks for providing these kinds of data.
Fine way of describing, and pleasant piece of writing to get information concerning my presentation subject.

item.title: El ICE es estupido - ojala lo privaticen - por eso seguiremos en el tercer mundo
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
No se me ocurre ninguna otra forma de hacer mas enfasis en la cochinada de institucion que es el ICE.
Todos los costarricenses sabemos que hacer cualquier tramite en el ICE es perder una mannana o una tarde. Son lo mas ineficiente que hay.
Me ha pasado de todo, desde pedir internet y dicen "diay no hay puertos", hacer filas interminables y cualquier tramite uno practicamente tiene que ir a rogarles para que le den a uno un servicio. Por cosas como esas es que estamos como estamos.
En Europa o Estados uno consigue una linea en minutos, aca lloran y le hacen a uno la vida imposible por cualquier cosa.
Acabo de ir y no me dieron una linea por que GSM hasta febrero empiezan a dar las listas de a quien se la van a dar. Y con 3G tampoco pues mi aparato no es el apropiado, que con factura que bla bla bla. Solo ponen trabas al crecimiento del pais!
A ELLOS QUE LES IMPORTA!!!!!!!!!!! Que se dediquen a dar buenos servicios y punto, para eso estan.
Y por cierto, quien hizo el website del ice? No se puede encontrar nada, las imagenes no son linkeables, dead links por todo lado...
Hasta dan ganas de llorar.....
DE VERDAD, PRIVATICEN EL ICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Y a ud que le ha pasado?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Diay mae que te digo.
Esta semana estoy por Panama y aca se pelean los clientes, promociones ridiculas y te dan un Blackberry, que al final no sale gratis (seguro que no) pero te dan algo.
En Costa Rica estamos retrasados en comunicaciones y facilidades de prepago, eso existe en Panama desde 1997 y veo como gran boom que el BCR empezara a comercializarlas...
Tarifas... por que carajos queremos todo regalado? Por tener tarifas regaladas es como estamos.
En fin, que linda es mi CR.

De hecho Chiri, linda mi costa rica....
Y no es solo por las tarifas, tambien es por gente incompetente que se mete a tomar decisiones, es tambien por que no se puede despedir gente, es mucho!!!!
Eso es lo que me daba tanta chicha con el pleito del TLC. Una empresa gubernamental sin compentencia es unicamente incompetent
por eso es que la competencia es tan necesaria, no para que el ICE desaparezca, sino para que mejore!

Ese es exactamente mi punto!!!!! Ponen demasiadas trabas a los usuarios! Yo me imagino a los ejecutivos del ice como un monton de gordos burocratas en un cuarto muriendose de risa por que disfrutan hacerle la vida imposible a los pobres ticos!
El ICE deberia dar un poco mas de libertad a sus usuarios! Deberia dar la posibilidad de que crezcamos y no ponerse con ese monton de trabas que poco les hace falta para ser comunistas!

Viera la chicha con la que ando justo por el ICE hoy, resulta que mi mama tenia su linea GSM a nombre de su anterior empleador, en su ultimo viaje le robaron el aparato, razon por la cual se quedo sin linea. Hoy ya harta de estar incomunicada fue a tratar de conseguir una linea y o sorpresa, como NUNCA tuvo una linea a su nombre ocupa un equipo nuevo con la factura a su nombre, y como solo tienen 3G para entrega inmediata, pues tiene que irse minimo de 1 teja para tener la linea, ya que el blackberry que le compre en eBay por $300 (aca sale mas del doble)no se lo aceptan.
como una empresa le pone tantas trabas a sus usuarios si estos lo unico que quieren es utilizar sus servicios PARA PAGARLES!
en fin...

item.title: Mistaken expectations and its effect on happiness
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: This guy summarizes some of the thoughts I've had in regards of how we humans have a weird way of making choices because of the "comparison factor". What do I mean? We make choices that most of the time don't make sense because we always compare to something else that maybe doesn't make sense in the first place. And business know that and they use it to their advance. Human behavior is complicated. Any how, enjoy the video http://www.ted.com/talks/dan_gilbert_researches_happiness.html And this one is just as great, it answers the following question: "why are we happy?" http://www.ted.com/talks/lang/eng/dan_gilbert_asks_why_are_we_happy.html Some quotes I like the most from this last talk: - "Natural happiness is what we get when we get when we wanted and synthetic happiness is what we MAKE when we don't get when we wanted" - "What kind of economic engine will keep churning if we believe that NOT getting what we want will make us just as happy as getting what we wanted" - "A mall full of zen monks will not be particularly profitable" That makes me think, should I buy a new car?

item.title: Can Microsoft find a better way to annoy its users? Upgrade Windows 7 RC
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
I thought that the two most annoying Microsoft related events where: - Restarting after every Windows update, which apparently happens every two days or so - Getting a bazillion emails from Microsoft for everything, which qualifies Microsoft as a huge spammer. But I guess we have a new winner. I received the email today, which I copy-pasted below. Apparently someone at Microsoft thought it was a brilliant idea to annoy users by restarting their machine every two hours without saving their work so that they will upgrade. I can only imagine this meeting.... I bet they laughed so hard about how their users will get the point when the computer reboots, so they will feel compelled to upgrade the RC for Windows 7. But haven't they stopped for a minute to think that this will be a completely frustrating experience which will just get users to start hating Windows 7 like they did with Windows Vista? Come on Microsoft! Think of a better way. Something more user friendly, find a way to motivate people! Make them feel excited about Windows 7 so they upgrade. But don't do something as stupid as this! Here is the line I love from this email
Starting on March 1, 2010 your PC will begin shutting down every two hours. Your work will not be saved during the shutdown.
And here is the full email
It’s time to upgrade from the Windows 7 Release Candidate While most people who tested Windows 7 have now moved to the final version, some are still running the Release Candidate. If you haven’t moved yet, it’s time to replace the RC. Starting on March 1, 2010 your PC will begin shutting down every two hours. Your work will not be saved during the shutdown. The Windows 7 RC will fully expire on June 1, 2010. Your PC running the Windows 7 RC will continue shutting down every two hours and your files won’t be saved during shutdown. In addition, your wallpaper will change to a solid black background with a persistent message on your desktop. You’ll also get periodic notifications that Windows isn’t genuine. That means your PC may no longer be able to obtain optional updates or downloads requiring genuine Windows validation. To avoid interruption, please reinstall a prior version of Windows or move to Windows 7. In either case, you’ll need to do a custom (clean) install to replace the RC. As with any clean installation, you’ll need to back up your data then reinstall your applications and restore the data. For more details about replacing the RC, see the Knowledge Base article KB 971767. For more information, visit the Window 7 Forum. Thanks again for helping us test Windows 7. The Windows 7 Team

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Christian,
I do agree of forcing users out of RC versions, but find a better way than shutting down every two hours. This annoying, frustrating and a horrible way to treat users.

I do like Windows 7 (except that I can't install the printer) and I know people should upgrade.
But just think about this, it is not upgrading, it is actually PAYING what Microsoft wants :)

I agree with Christian, they have to force the users to upgrade, and they're warning you with enough time, my computer also displayed a message the day before I got the e-mail.
I think if you're affected with the shutdowns it's because you want to, I mean, I'm using RC also and I know I'm using beta software that might not be as stable as released software, I didn't pay anything for it, and they're being kind enough to give me enough time to upgrade (or downgrade if you don't like Windows 7 enough).
Regards

I do agree that Windows restarts on updates a mayor nuisance, especially in Windows XP.
That being said, I think Microsoft is doing the right thing to force users out of RC for various reasons. The first one is the user's security. There is no guarantee that security software will work the same way in RC vs. RTM, so a user's anti-virus/firewall program might not function properly without the user realizing this. Secondly, I don't know if an RC machine is able to go through Windows Updates, and a machine w/o these updates is a clear target for disaster. An RC candidate is not meant to be used as a production machine, and this was very clear when they made this public.
Perhaps the approach is not the most friendly one, but people these days do not pay attention to e-mails requesting action. So yeah, very aggressive from their part but that's the only way people understand these days.
BTW, A Windows Server 2008 R2 machine beyond the 180 trial will shut itself off every 2 hours as well. Note that this happens on the RTM version, not the RC.
My ¢2.

item.title: Taller de Servicio Grupo Q - Record de agencia y revisiones
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Hace un par de dias lleve el carro de mi esposa que es 2003 a la agencia a que le revisaran una cosa. Me metieron el tuco de una manera jejeje, de hecho conte la historia aca http://www.sentidocomunencostarica.com/foro/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=41 Hoy venia pasando en frente de grupo q y por vino decidi ver que tan diferente es en precios comparado con la Nissan. Asi a ojo de buen cubero y metiche, me parece que los precios son mas razonables. Aca esta la tabla comparativa Nota: Delen click a la imagen para verla completa [caption id="attachment_233" caption="Taller de servicio Grupo Q - Hyundai - Precios de revisiones y cambios de aceite"][/caption] La pregunta mia es: de verdad vale la pena llevarle el record de agencia a un carro? Cuando deberia uno dejar de llevarlo? Cuando se le vence la garantia?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Xavi...sinceramente el record de agencia es bueno tenerlo pero cuando el carro vos lo compras de agencia y 2 o máximo 3 años despues lo vas a vender xq así lo vendes con garantía de que los arreglos no han sido "macgyver"...pero yo creo q si uno compra un carro de 2da (como en el caso de ustedes q ya el carro tiene 6 años) me parece q es una perdida de plata llevarlo a la agencia xq en cualquier mecanico el arreglo seguro te cuesta la mitad
Me acuerdo cuando mi hermano compró el Xtrail (un 2005 comprado en Oct 2007), y le tocó hacerle el cambío de aceite y xq estaba aun en garantía lo llevó a la Nissan...y salió hasta con dolor de billetera cuando pago mas de 60mil pesos x un cambio en un Smartlube seguro le hubiera costado como 30mil (a lo sumo)

Estoy totalmente de acuerdo con eso, pero en este caso el carro lo saco mi suegro de agencia, se lo vendio a mi esposa y todavia esta super bien cuidado, entonces creo qeu todavia vale la pena llevarlo ahi.
Ya cuando empiece a joder son otros 100 pesos!

item.title: No a manejar ebrios en Costa Rica
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded: Nota: La vigilia es mañana jueves 18, a las 5pm en el bulevar de la Asamblea Legislativa No se quien es Miguel Jara, pero si se quien es Christopher pues su esposa es muy amiga de mi madre, quien les hizo la boda. Tampoco voy a decir que soy un santo y nunca he manejado borracho, por que el que me conoce bien sabe que soy culpable de mil y una estupideces que a veces se han pasado incluso de los limites de lo legal y del sentido comun. Pero quiero compartir esto con todos para ver si los diputados recapacitan y multan el manejar ebrio de la manera en la que tiene que ser. No puede ser posible que este pais solo por los intereses de los duennos de los bares se dobleguen los diputados (para no decir que se bajan los pantalones) y darles gusto. NO SE PUEDE VIVIR CON MIEDO A SALIR A LA CALLE A QUE LO ATROPELLEN A UNO. Yo mismo vengo al trabajo en bici desde Curridabat a la Sabana. Bueno, aca esta el mensaje que me enviaron y quiero compartir Por Miguel Jara Mi amigo Christopher Lang, un odontólogo de apenas 31 años, salió, el domingo pasado, como todos los días, a entrenarse en su bicicleta. Lo hizo antes de las 7 de la mañana. Se despidió de su esposa y dos hijos con la promesa de regresar pronto para asistir a la iglesia. Mientras Christhoper dormía para ejercitarse como atleta, pues practicaba el triatlón, un borracho pasaba toda la noche de fiesta. Tomó whisky... Paradójicamente, el borracho también apenas llegaba a los 30 años. En enero la prensa costarricense anuncia que gracias a la dureza de la ley, Costa Rica bajó casi un 50% la detención de choferes ebrios. Dos vidas paralelas. Dos momentos diferentes. Christopher trabajaba duro todos los días para cumplir sus metas como esposo, padre, profesional, y atleta. Era, además, un hijo, hermano y amigo ejemplar. El borracho se sube a su vehículo de lujo, último modelo, y se dispone a manejar a más de 100 kilómetros por hora desde San José hasta Cartago para ir a dormir a su casa después de tremenda juerga. El destino los encuentra a ambos poco después de las siete de la mañana en la autopista que lleva a Cartago. A finales de febrero los diputados ceden y rebajan hasta un 70% las penas de La Ley de Transito ante la presión de sectores con intereses económicos como la Cámara de Restaurantes y Afines. Los borrachos ahora pueden tomar más y pagar menos. Los actos preparatorios para ese encuentro con la muerte estaban dados. Christopher le dijo a sus amigos, el pasado miércoles, “estoy muy feliz pues ya voy a estrenar mi casita dentro de dos semanas. Eso sí voy a tener que ver qué hago para entrenar porque Santa Ana es un poco peligroso, hay más carros”. El borracho maneja somnoliento. Lo hace con escasos reflejos pero a toda velocidad. Con alevosía y sabedor de que la ley es alcahueta, olvida las campañas publicitarias “Si toma no maneje”. Al final, ambos se encuentran en una carretera. Uno practicaba deporte. Otro, como verdadero analfabeto del espíritu, carga su whisky en el estomago camino a Cartago. Viaja a dormir su borrachera. Christopher muere a las 7:10 a.m. arrollado por el borracho. Su auto de lujo lo tumba a la orilla de la carretera. Se da cuenta de lo que hizo. No le importa un bledo. Huye cobardemente y deja tirado el cuerpo del atleta en una cuneta. Mas adelante, delatado por su propia cobardía, es detenido por exceso de velocidad. Conduce, con 0.93 gramos por litro de sangre de alcohol en su sangre. Niega haber atropellado a mi amigo a pesar de que le falta un pedazo a su carro. El ebrio olvidó que dejó, junto al cuerpo del atleta, el parachoques de su auto. La bicicleta del atleta quedó, junto a su cuerpo, como un rompecabezas. El golpe fue brutal. Diez minutos después de suceder aquella muerte, llego al lugar donde se encontraba el cuerpo de mi amigo, acompañado de mi esposa. También llegamos a ese lugar en bicicleta. Miro el cuerpo. Aquello es una tragedia. Me detengo a preguntar y otro ciclista llorando me dice “hoy salí a enseñarle a mi hijo lo importante de hacer deporte y pasa esto”. La mente brillante de los diputados de este país considera que a los borrachos se les debe dar “una segunda oportunidad”, según dijo Carlos Peréz del PLN. Lo dijo después de reformar la ley. ¿Qué hacen estos diputados viajando por todo el mundo si no ven la razón de que otros países no tienen estos problemas? Es una posibilidad si nos fijamos en la cuenta que por licor le pagamos todos los costarricenses en cada administración a los “Padres de la Patria”. Estos diputados son los mismos que no renuncian a su inmunidad, a pesar de que algunos de ellos atropellan y matan borrachos a personas. Otros acosan a mujeres y uno escribe memorándums ofensivos para el pueblo o, simplemente, viajan en avioneta y nunca serán atropellados. Mi amigo murió el domingo. Lo mató un hombre, casi de su edad, un hombre de su generación, de mi generación, después de tomar alcohol y pasar la noche en una fiesta. A mi amigo lo dejaron muerto en el caño de una acera como si fuese un perro muerto. Alguien se apiadó al ver aquello y le tiró una sabana encima. Quien lo mato es hijo de un ex diputado que tampoco hizo nada por detener esas carnicerías que, cada día, se producen en las calles. Cuando algunos diputados intentaron frenar esas muertes, otros opinaron que la mano dura era demasiado pesada. A mi amigo lo mató su propia generación. La mató la generación que nadie quiere. Su único pecado fue salir a entrenarse en bicileta donde muchos corren a cien kilómetros por hora porque creen que ahí no caben los ciclistas. Apunten, señores diputados, en el talonario del cheque que cobran, mensualmente, otra muerte.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Invita a la vigilia de mañana jueves 18, a las 5pm en el bulevar de la Asamblea Legislativa
Gracias por avisar, acabo de agregarlo

item.title: Concierto de Gun's and Roses, la fila, birras y el respeto a la policia
item.dc:creator: Xavier
item.content:encoded:
Hoy estaba leyendo la nacion y me encontre algunas cosas vacilonas del concierto de Guns and Roses. Primero que todo, que desastre los maes que estaban vendiendo birras que se terminaron agarrando con los policias. Si es un poco de plata, probablemente gastaron unos 12 rojos, pero ojo como tratan a los policias. Yo creo que deberian de meterles un buen "tate quieto" para que aprendan a respetar la autoridad [caption id="attachment_253" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="tirarle birra a un policia"][/caption] "Nooooooooo, las birras nooooooooooo" [caption id="attachment_254" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="noooooo, mis birras noooooooo"][/caption] Y esta foto que esta de premio, apenas pa enviarla en la tarjeta de navidad a la familia. Que madre mas orgullosa la de este mae si viera esta foto [caption id="attachment_255" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="mmmmmmm las birras las birras"][/caption] Primero en ‘la fila’! Un mae llego a hacer fila desde media noche. No se que es peor, estar asi solo o hacer fila 19 dias antes?
Solitario. Ayer en la mañana, Douglas Arroyo acudió al Estadio Ricardo Saprissa con la idea de obtener uno de los primeros campos en la fila para el concierto de Guns N’ Roses. La tarea le ha resultado mucho más fácil de lo que anticipó: al llegar el mediodía, era el único aficionado en el sitio y ni siquiera sabía dónde hacer fila. “Yo pensé que iba a estar más lleno esto”, explicó el hombre de 31 años, operador de maquinaria especial, quien llegó temprano con la intención de quedarse a dormir en las afueras del Estadio. “Espero que sean igual de buenos a como se oyen”, manifestó Arroyo.
Aca se ve en la nacion donde sale la historia chistosa [caption id="attachment_251" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Primero en la fila...solo"][/caption]
